page.title: 04A mixed farm in Lullington
page.content: Creamery Farm is situated in Lullington village. It is a family business. The farmers two sons are partners and will eventually take over the farm. It is an average sized farm covering a total of 170 acres. The fields range in size from 2 - 23 acres. They are planted with wheat, barley and ley grass for silage. Some of the cereals are used as fodder, especially barley. The rest goes for milling. There is also permanent pasture for the 85 Friesian dairy cows. The milk is sold to the Milk Marketing Board. Northern Daires collect it and take it to Ashby for bottling. Barren cows go for slaughter & Friesian bull calves are sold at either Lichfield, Derby or Uttoxeter market. Heifer claves are kept to add to the herd.
